documentation.text:
@notice Retrieves the number of decimals for the Eduxp points.
 @dev This function is an override of the ERC20 function, so that we can pass the 0 value.

devdoc.details: Open Action Module for giving reward for completing lessons.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

balanceOf(address).details: This overrides the ERC20 function because we don't have access to `_totalSupply` and we aren't using the  internal transfer method.

params.account: The account to retrieve the EDUXP points balance of

returns._0: The EDUXP points balance of the account

decimals().details: This function is an override of the ERC20 function, so that we can pass the 0 value.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

getRewardReceiver(uint256,uint256).details: Returns the reward receiver for lesson.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: for now we check for keccak('EDUX_MODULE'); Override this and add the type(IModuleInterface).interfaceId for corresponding module type

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

totalSupply().details: This overrides the ERC20 function because we don't have access to `_totalSupply` and we aren't using the  internal transfer method.

transfer(address,uint256).details: This function will always revert as we don't allow EDUXP transfers.

params.amount: The amount of EDUXP points to transfer
params.recipient: The recipient of the EDUXP points

returns._0: A boolean indicating if the transfer was successful

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: This function will always revert as we don't allow EDUXP transfers.

params.amount: The amount of EDUXP points to transfer
params.recipient: The recipient of the EDUXP points
params.sender: The sender of the EDUXP points

returns._0: A boolean indicating if the transfer was successful

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

_rewardReceivers.details: Mapping of reward receivers for lesson.

devdoc.title: RewardActionModule

balanceOf(address).notice: Retrieves the Eduxp points balance of an account.

decimals().notice: Retrieves the number of decimals for the Eduxp points.

totalSupply().notice: Retrieves the total supply of Eduxp points.

transfer(address,uint256).notice: The override of the transfer method to prevent the EDUXP token from being transferred.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: The override of the transferFrom method to prevent the EDUXP token from being transferred.
